p.rend: COMALA. Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / für Solo, Chor und Orchester / in Musik gesetzt / von / Niels. W. Gade. / Op. 12. / [...] / Eigenthum der Verleger. / LEIPZIG UND BRÜSSEL, BREITKOPF & HÄRTEL. / Eingetragen in das Vereinsarchiv. / 7543. 10863 16300. Ch.B.59. V.A.429.

annot.p: Paperback, sewn, in grey cover. On the front cover is printed a list of Gade’s "Grössere Gesangwerke mit Orchesterbegleitung" published by Breitkopf & Härtel. The leaf following the title page contains the argument and the text (in German) with reference to page numbers. An unchanged lithographic reproduction of this first edition was published around 1893 with the plate number Part. B. 706.

item.label: Ag: Printed score, Gade’s personal copy

annot.p: The dating 1887 is added in blue crayon on front cover, in Gade’s hand. The copy does not contain any annotations or additions except for a correction in pencil to the tenor parts in No.1, bar 87. Otherwise as A.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Comala / dramatisches Gedicht / nach Ossian / componirt / von / Niels W: Gade. / Op. 12. / Leipzig/ bey / Breitkopf u. Härtel. Added in pencil, in Gade’s hand: (1845-46.)

annot.p:
In full cloth binding stamped COMALA. in gold on front cover. Hand-written label pasted on front cover inscribed Op. 12. / Comala / Partitur. Pagination is sporadic, pages 107-162 incorrectly paginated 106-161. At the end of the music on p. 161 [recte 162] is the dating Leipzig den 11 Märtz 1846 / Königstr: N o
16. At top of page 3 inscribed in runes ᚵᚢᚦ: ᚵᛁᚢᛅ: ᛚᚤᚴᚴᛅ: (GUD GIVE LYKKE).

titleStmt.title: C: Score, manuscript copy from Breitkopf & Härtel

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Ornamental frame and BREITKOPF & HÄRTEL IN LEIPZIG. printed on front cover. Title added in ink: Comala / von / N. W. Gade. / Partitur

physDesc.physMedium: Written on light blue paper. Hand-ruled (22 staves).

annot.p: In half binding; brown cardboard cover with green cloth on spine and corners. Label pasted on front cover stamped Mus-n / 1493. Stamped below the label: Fürstl. Bestand. Pp. 2-228 paginated in pencil. Both layers of additions are in the same hand, the ones in pencil apparently added first. Additions are mainly completions of dynamic indications, but also some exclusively performance-related. The first cut in No. 9 found in A and B was also applied in C as is apparent from pencil crosses on pp. 162 and 171 and from the bended corners of the pages in between. Condition: very good, few traces of use.Manuscript copy as sold by Breitkopf & Härtel between 1846 and 1889. Several other such publisher-made copies are known, though copied by different hands (D-Sl HB XVII 177; D-LEm PM 5044; I-OS Mss.Mus.A 8). Together with the score is an incomplete set of parts (14 manuscript parts: S.1 (2), S.2 (3), A.1 (2), A.2, T.1, B.1 (3), B.2 and cb., probably written by a local scribe, and 1 printed part: Dersagrena).

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: COMALA / Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / für Solo, Chor und Orchester / in Musik gesetzt / von / Niels W. Gade. / Op. 12. / Clavierauszug. / Eigenthum der Verleger. / Leipzig, bei Breitkopf & Härtel. / 7540. / Eingetragen in das Vereinsarchiv.. A reprint of the vocal score has the price Pr. 3 Thlr. 10 Ngr. = Mk.10._ added below the publisher's name. The reprint omits the dedication and has the initial argument and libretto re-set.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: On the second leaf: SEINER MAJESTÄT / dem Könige von Dänemark / CHRISTIAN VIII. / ehrfurchtsvoll gewidmet.

annot.p: Pages 1-2 unpaginated, containing the argument and text (in German). Page 74 blank. The copies studied are in binding not retaining the original cover. The vocal score was announced as a novelty of "last week" in Signale für die musikalische Welt 4 (November 1846), p. 358, and in Hofmeister's Musikalisch-literarischer Monatsbericht in January 1847.

item.label: Dmf1: Vocal score, first edition, The Music Society's copy

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Title on front cover (cut-out from original cover): Comala / von / GADE. / Op. 12. / Clavierauszug. / Leipzig, bei Breitkopf & Härtel. / Pr. 3 Thlr. 10 Ngr.

annot.p: In leather half-binding with marbled sides. Oval cut-out from the original cover pasted on front cover. Printed label pasted on front cover in lower left corner: Musikforeningens Archiv. / Claveer-Udtog., stamped 127 and with the title added in ink: Gade, N. W / Comala / (med underlagt dansk Text). Danish text added in ink throughout (probably in 1871). A few changes are added in pencil, in Gades hand. Numerous notes on the instrumentation added in pencil in an unknown hand. Very worn copy; lower corners missing from many pages. Otherwise as D.

item.label: Dmf2: Vocal score, first edition, The Music Society's copy

annot.p: In cloth quarter binding with marbled sides. Printed label pasted on front cover in lower left corner: Musikforeningens Archiv. / Claveer-Udtog. / B. N o . [added in ink:] 127; title added in ink: Gade / Comala. Danish Text added in pencil in at least three different hands and partly also in blue crayon. Otherwise as D.

p.rend: COMALA. / Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / für Solo, Chor und Orchester / in Musik gesetzt / von / NIELS W. GADE. / Op. 12. / Clavierauszug. / Eigenthum der Verleger. / LEIPZIG UND BRÜSSEL, / BREITKOPF & HÄRTEL. / Eingetragen in das Vereinsarchiv. / V.A.429.

annot.p: Published between December 1884 and February 1885 according to a letter from Breitkopf & Härtel to Gade (8 December 1884) and an announcement in Hofmeisters Monatsberichte of February 1885. The music is re-engraved for this edition and lithographically reproduced.Table of contents on p. 1; p. 78 blank. Paperback, sewn, in gray paper cover with black frontispiece reading VOLKS- / AUSGABE in upper left corner, BREITKOPF / & HÆRTEL in upper right corner, and Verlag von Breitkopf und Härtel in Leipzig at the bottom. Title printed in red in the middle:Gade / Comala / Klavierauszug mit Text / 429.

item.label: Eg1: Vocal score, Volksausgabe, Gade’s personal copy

titleStmt.title: EII: Vocal score, Volksausgabe, revised edition

p.rend: NIELS W. GADE / COMALA / Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / für Solo, Chor und Orchester / OP. 12. / Klavierauszug mit Text / Eigentum der Verleger für alle Länder / BREITKOPF & HÄRTEL / LEIPZIG · BRÜSSEL · LONDON · NEW YORK / V.A.429.

annot.p: Table of contents on p. 1, p. 78 blank. Paperback, sewn, in blue paper cover. Front page: Volksausgabe Breitkopf & Härtel / No. 429 / GADE / Komala / Op. 12 / Klavierauszug / mit Text / Verlag von Breitkopf & Härtel / Leipzig. Vocal and piano parts revised in many details to better correspond to the printed score. Some pages (23, 24, 55, 58, 61) entirely re-engraved, otherwise a revised lithographic reprint of EI . The dating is based on the indication (VIII/04) below the price list on the back cover.

item.label: Emf2: Vocal score, Volksausgabe, revised edition, The Music Society's copy

annot.p: On front page: The number 127 added in blue crayon in upper left corner; Carl Nielsen (in Carl Nielsen's hand) added in pencil in upper right corner; Autoriseret Udgave / for Danmark, Norge og Sverige / Skandinavisk Musikforlag / Kjøbenhavn stamped in lower margin. Danish text partly added in pencil.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Comala's part: COMALA / Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / in Musik gesetzt von / NIELS W. GADE. / Op. 12. / SINGSTIMMEN. / Eigenthum der Verleger. / Leipzig, bei Breitkopf & Härtel. / Comala.

annot.p: Text in German.13 parts: Comala, Dersagrena, Melicoma, Fingal, Soprano I, Sopran II Solo, Sopran II, Alt I, Alt II, Tenor I, Tenor II, Bass I, Bass II. The parts were announced as a novelty of "last week" in Signale für die musikalische Welt 4 (November 1846), p. 358, and in Hofmeister's Musikalisch-literarischer Monatsbericht in January 1847.

item.label: Fg1: Printed vocal parts, Gade’s personal copy

annot.p: Includes the choral parts only. Otherwise as FI .

item.label: Fmf1: Printed vocal parts, The Music Society's copy

annot.p: 98 parts: Comala (2), Melicoma (2), Fingal (2), Soprano I (12), Sopran II Solo, Sopran II (12), Alt I (11), Alt II (11), Tenor I (10), Tenor II (12), Bass I (12), Bass II (11). Incomplete; Dersagrena missing.Each part glued in a blue paper cover with the part's name and the number 127 or N. W. Gade / Comala added in ink. Danish text added in pencil, ink, or red ball pen to some of the solo parts: Comala (1), Melicoma (2), Fingal (2). In Fingal's parts, changes to a higher pitch in No. 2 (as in B) are added in pencil. One copy of Fingal's part has the Danish text added in ink, with numerous changes added in pencil (19th century?). The other copy has the Danish text added in red ball pen (20th century), retaining the changes made in pencil in the first copy.Otherwise as FI .

titleStmt.title: FII: Printed choral parts, Chor-Bibliothek edition

annot.p: Revised to correspond to the printed score.

titleStmt.title: GII: Printed orchestral parts, Orchester-Bibliothek edition

annot.p: Revised to correspond to the printed score.

5 parts: Comala, Dersagrena (2), Melicoma (2). Incomplete; Fingal missing. Dersagrena [1] and Melicoma [1] copied by the same scribe, presumably for the 1856 performance in Copenhagen. Dersagrena [2] apparently copied by the same scribe as Dersagrena [1] and Melicoma [1] for the first performance in Danish in 1871. Comala and Melicoma [2] are later copies (probably late 19th or early 20th century).

Written in brown ink on hand-ruled paper (12 staves). Glued in a blue paper cover. Text in German. Danish text partly added in black ink. Includes the passages originally to be sung by Melicoma. Danish text added later in ink and Melicoma's passages marked Melicoma. Some corrections in pencil (Gade?)
Written in brown ink on hand-ruled paper (12 staves). Glued in a blue paper cover. Text in German.

Written in ink on hand-ruled paper (10 staves), oblong format. Sewn, in blue paper cover. Text in Danish. Includes the passages originally to be sung by Melicoma. Melicoma's passages later crossed out in blue crayon.
Written in black ink on hand-ruled paper (8 staves), oblong format, unbound. Text in Danish.
Written in black ink on hand-ruled paper (8 staves), oblong format, unbound.Text in Danish.

physDesc.physMedium: Each part originally glued in a cover of blue paper. Later the paper covers have been removed and parts were sewn into brown paper cover and cropped (probably library binding). Printed label with Christian X's coat of arms and DET KONGELIGE BIBLIOTEK / MUSIKAFDELINGEN glued onto each part. N. W. Gade. / Comala. and instrument name added to each label in ink.

annot.p: 51 parts: vl.1 (7), vl.2 (6), vla.(4), vlc./cb. (7), fl.1, fl.2 (2), ob.1 (2), ob.2 (2), cl.1 (2), cl.2 (2), fg.1,2, cor.1-4, tr.1,2, trb.1-3, tb., timp., ptti., arpa (2). Originally glued into a blue paper cover, later replaced by a brown cardboard cover (library binding). Presumably copied in 1850 for the first performance in Denmark. Label printed with Christian X's coat of arms and the text DET KONGELIGE BIBLIOTEK / MUSIKAFDELINGEN pasted on each cover. N. W. Gade / Comala. and the instrument's name written on labels in ink. Numerous additions in pencil, crayon and ball pen. As is evident from remarks in several parts, the parts were in use several times after Gade's death – in 1906, 1907, 1917, 1918, 1924, 1925, 1946, 1953 and as late as February 1967 for a radio concert commemorating Gade's 150th anniversary.

titleStmt.title: J: Printed choral parts with Danish text

annot.p: 4 parts: Soprani, Alti, Tenori, Bassi. First edition with text in Danish, probably printed by Horneman & Erslev for the first performance in Danish in 1871. Printed without plate numbers directly from the engraved plates. Two reprint editions of these parts were published.

item.label: Jmf: Printed vocal parts with Danish text, The Music Society's copy

annot.p: 150 parts: S (50), A (32), T (28), B (40). Some of the parts (29 + 19 + 14 + 22) are from the original edition without plate numbers, some from the first reprint (10 + 13 + 14 + 18), and additional 11 soprano parts are WH reprints. Three of the latter parts are stamped Dansk Koncert-Forening / København on first page. Some of the parts glued into blue paper cover.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: COMALA, Digt efter Ossian. SOPRANI. N. W. Gade. Op. 12.

annot.p: The first reprint has the plate number 926 added, indicating that the plates were engraved for and published by Horneman & Erslev. In that case the plate number was probably added in 1874 (cf. Dan Fog: Musikhandel i Danmark, vol. II, p.182).

The second reprint is a lithographic reproduction of the original plates, made after Wilhelm Hansen had taken over Horneman & Erslev in 1879 and published by Wilhelm Hansen as number WH 926. On the first page is printed in lower margin: Kjøbenhavn, Wilhelm Hansens Forlag. On the last page, in lower margin: Wilhelm Hansens Nodestik-og Tryk, Kjöbenhavn. The publisher's name seems to indicate that the parts were printed in 1879, since in that same year the name form Wilhelm Hansens Musik-Forlag was to become the one usually employed.

In library binding. Contains: fols. 1r-2r: sketch of No. 1 (Chor der Krieger und Barden) and the first 2 bars of No. 2; fols. 2r-2v: No. 3 (Chor der Krieger); fol. 2v (upside down): sketch of the male choir in No. 9 (Chor der Krieger). Dating on fols. 1r: febr. 46. / Leipzig in the upper left corner and signed Niels W. Gade. in upper right corner.

titleStmt.title: L: Piano arrangement, 2 hands without words

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Comala / Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / für Solo, Chor u. Orchester / in Musik gesetzt / von / NIELS W. GADE. / Op. 12. / Klavierauszug zu zwei Händen ohne Worte Pr. 1 Thlr. 15 Ngr. / Klavierauszug zu vier Händen ohne Worte [Pr.] 2 [Thlr.] 15 [Ngr.] / Eigenthum der Verleger. / Leipzig, bei Breitkopf & Härtel. / Eingetragen in das Vereinsarchiv. / Entd. Sta. Hall / 8829. 30.Front cover identical to title page.

annot.p: Pp. 3 to 39 paginated, pp. 2 and 40 blank.

item.label: Lg: Piano arrangement, 2 hands without words, Gade’s personal copy

physDesc.physMedium: Unbound, in green paper cover. The copy does not contain any additions or corrections.

titleStmt.title: M: Piano arrangement, 4 hands without words

annot.p: Pp. 2 to 59 paginated, p. 60 blank. Paperback, sewn, in blue cover.

item.label: Mg: Piano arrangement, 4 hands without words, Gade’s personal copy

annot.p: The copy does not contain any additions or corrections.

p.rend: MUSIKALSK ANTHOLOGIE / UDVALGTE STYKKER / AF / Danske Operaer, Balletter, Syngespil og andre Sangcompositioner. / UDSATTE / FOR / PIANOFORTE. / Første Aargang. / KJØBENHAVN. / FORLAGT AF IMMANUEL RÉE, / Bog- og Musikhandler. / 1856.

titlePage.label: Title on first page
titlePage.p: COMALA, dramatisk Digt efter Ossian af NIELS W. GADE. / For at opmuntre Comala – Kong Fingals Brud – der ængstes, medens Helten færdes paa / Kamppladsen, synge hendes Terner følgende / BALLADE.

titlePage.label: At the bottom of the first page

p.rend: Musikalsk Anthologie Iste Aarg. 1 Hefte. / Kjøbenhavn. Forl. af I. Rée.

annot.p: Published in: Musikalsk Anthologie, vol. 1/I (February 1856), pp. 5-6. Piano arrangement without words of No. 5 in Comala, arranged by Gade.

p.rend: BALLADE / af / ”COMALA” / dramatisk Digt efter Ossian / af / Niels W. Gade. / Arrangementet af Komponisten / Forlæggerens Eiendom. / KJÖBENHAVN. / Wilhelm Hansens Musik-Forlag.

annot.p: Reprint by Wilhelm Hansen as a separate item with the plate number replacing the original publisher's information at the bottom of the first page.

p.rend: Unsere Meister. / XXIII / Sammlung / auserlesener Werke / für das Pianoforte / (Originale und Bearbeitungen) / von / Niels W. Gade. / Eigenthum der Verleger. / LEIPZIG, Breitkopf & Härtel. / V.A.751.

annot.p: Lithographic print. Contains 21 pieces, two of which are from Comala: Ballade aus "Comala" (No. 11; pp.48-49; corresponds to No. 5 in Comala) and Lied aus "Comala" (No. 12; pp. 49-50; corresponds to No. 8); the arrangements are identical to the ones in L.

item.label: Og: Excerpts, piano arrangement, Gade's personal copy

physDesc.physMedium: In leather quarter binding with marbled sides. Label pasted on front cover with Frederik VII's monogram and added in ink: Niels W. Gade: / Auserlesene Werke (1-21) / für das Pianoforte.–

titleStmt.title: P: Excerpt, vocal score with Danish text ("Dersagrenas Ballade" and "Fingals Klage ved Comalas Liig")

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Romancer og Sange / med / Piano=Accompagnement / componerede af / NIELS W: GADE. [...] Forlæggerens Eiendom / KIÖBENHAVN / hos / Horneman & Erslev / (Emil Erslev.).

annot.p: Unbound, pp. 4-5 numbered 8-9, otherwise no pagination; p. 6 blank. The piano arrangements are nearly identical to those in D and E.Fingals Klage pp. 8-9 (recte 4-5) has the plate no. 15. 2. Probably printed between 1860 and 1874. The print contains Nos. 5 and 11 from Comala. The plate numbers and misleading page numbers in Fingals Klage seem to indicate that these two pages were originally engraved for some other publication. In Dan Fog: N.W. Gade-katalog, en fortegnelse over Niels W. Gades trykte kompositioner (1817-1890), p. 19, the print is dated 1860. In that case, a Danish translation of these two pieces was made before the translation of the entire libretto for the 1871 performance in Danish. This could also explain the substantial textual deviations from other Danish sources, especially in Fingals Klage. In the middle of the front page is a list of eight publications in this series; the entry concerning Comala reads: 4. Comala 1. Dersagrenas Ballade 2. Fingals Klagesang ...... 36 ß [skilling; the currency unit skilling was in use until 1874].

titleStmt.title: R: Vocal score with English text (British first edition)

p.rend: NOVELLO'S ORIGINAL OCTAVO EDITION / COMALA / A DRAMATIC POEM AFTER OSSIAN / (FOR SOLO, CHORUS, AND ORCHESTRA), / SET TO MUSIC BY / NIELS W. GADE. / THE ENGLISH VERSION TRANSLATED FROM THE GERMAN OF DR. KLENGEL BY / REV. J. TROUTBECK, M.A. / Ent. Sta. Hall. / Price, in paper covers, 2s. / " scarlet cloth, 4s. / LONDON: NOVELLO, EWER AND CO., / 1, BERNERS STREET (W.), AND 80 & 81, QUEEN STREET (E.C.) / NEW YORK: J. L. PETERS, 843, BROADWAY. / A Pianoforte Arrangement of this work for four hands may also be had.

annot.p: Bound edition: In red full cloth binding with embossed ornamentation. Title COMALA. / NOVELLO'S EDITION. printed in gold on front cover and COMALA. NIELS W. GADE. on spine.The piano arrangement of this edition corresponds to the german vocal score.

titleStmt.title: S: Vocal score with English text (American first edition)

p.rend: [Comala, a dramatic poem, after Ossian. Set to music for soli, chorus, and orchestra, op. 12. Translated from the German, by J. C. D. Parker]

titleStmt.title: ZB: Vocal score with English text (british first edition)

item.label: ZBg: Vocal score with English text, Gade's personal copy

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Comalas Tod. / eine Episode aus Ossian

annot.p: Julius Klengel's fair copy of the text. Contains alternative versions to many sections of the text, generally rejected by Gade (crossed out in red crayon). Several layers of cancellations and corrections by Gade, especially to the last three sections (Nos. 10-12). The final version of No. 12 is added at the end in ink (Gade) according to the additional draft (TB).

Contains Julius Klengel's suggested changes to the fair copy of the libretto (TI ), mainly to some of the choirs and Fingal's part. Two sections are cancelled in pencil. Furthermore cancellations, corrections and comments in Gade's hand.

p.rend: Comala. / Dramatisches Gedicht / nach Ossian, / componirt / von / N. W. Gade. / Jeder Nachdruck dieses Textbuchs, auch von Seiten der Concertdirectionen für / ihre Aufführungen, ist verboten. / Leipzig, / Druck und Verlag von Breitkopf und Härtel.

annot.p: Pages 1-3 unpaginated. Page 2 contains the argument, pages 3-12 the text (in German). Text set in Fraktur. The libretto was included in Breitkopf & Härtel’s Textbibliothek series as No. 53. It was later re-published with the text set in an Antiqua typeface (10 pages; c. 1880?).

p.rend: Comala, / Dramatisk dikt efter Ossian. / Musiken / af / N. W. Gade. / Fri öfversättning. / Lund, / tryckt uti Berlingska Boktryckeriet, / 1857.

annot.p: In 8o format, sewn. Pp. 2-8 paginated. P. 2 contains the argument, pp. 3-10 the text (in Swedish). The copy does not contain any additions or corrections.

item.label: Vg: Printed libretto in Swedish, Gade’s personal copy

p.rend: This file may be used to illustrate the use of items and components for the description of sources. For instance, note the description of specific copies of a print separate from the general description of the print run (sources A, D, EI , EII etc.), and the description of sets of parts (H and J), giving a general description of the set as well as descriptions of the indivdual parts. Source J combines these two options to describe a printed set of parts and a specific copy of it.

termList.term: Music for choir, vocal soloists and instruments

event.persName: Feodor von Milde or Carl Roth (Fingal)

event.p: Memorial concert for Niels W. Gade

titleStmt.title: No. 1. Chor der Krieger und Barden
No. 1. Fingals Krigere

incipText.p: Auf, auf, auf, laut schallt das Horn
Frem, frem, frem, fremad til Kamp
Heute noch brech' ich des stolzen Königs Macht
Alt i Kvæld slaar jeg den stolte Konges Hær

expression.tempo: Andante – Più lento – Andante con moto

incipText.p: Auf, auf in die Schlacht, Fingal führt uns zum Sieg!
Frem, fremad til Kamp, fremad til Kamp. Fingal fører til Seir.
O grauenvolle Stille! Dahin, dahin sind die lieblichen Träume
Hvor alt er tyst og stille. De svandt, de svandt de livsalige Drømme!
Vom Lochlin kam gezogen Suaran, der stolze Held
Suaran, den Lochlins Konge, drog over Bølgen blaa
Still, still ist die Jagd, kein Laut ertönt, als das Brausen des Stroms
Ak! Snart er det Nat, alt Vinden suser i Granernes Top.

expression.tempo: Moderato – Allegro non troppo – Più allegro

incipText.p: Wir wandeln auf dem Sturm
Vi drage som Storm over Hede
O, o, dass ich nicht sitze an Caruns Wellen
O! o! sad jeg dog hist ved Caruns Vover!
Entfloh'n ist der Feind' Getöse, nicht sieht man sein Ross auf den Höhen
Nu flygter den stolte Caracul, hans Ganger foer bort over Heden
Lasst ab vom lauten Siegsgesang, ihr Krieger Fingals, schweigt, o schweigt!
O stands den glade Seierssang, du Fingals Kriger ti, o ti!

expression.tempo: Andante con moto – Più vivace – Tempo I

incipText.p: Lasst mich schauen die Geliebte, zeiget, wo die Holde schläft
Sorgens Taarer stille svæve om min Elsktes Hvilested.

titleStmt.title: No. 12. Chor der Barden und Jungfrauen
No. 12

incipText.p: Aus den Wolken herab schauen die Geister der Ahnen
Høit fra Skyernes Krands skue de Henfarnes Aander
